intro: Saxifraga nervosa var. major, commonly known as the large-veined saxifrage, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Saxifraga nervosa var. major is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
